source.de81b646:
from dataprep.eda import create_report
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("../input/los-angeles-crime-data-20102020/Crime_Data_from_2020_to_Present.csv")
create_report(df)
source.f666e507:
import sweetviz as sv

# EDA using Sweetviz
sweet_report = sv.analyze(pd.read_csv("../input/los-angeles-crime-data-20102020/Crime_Data_from_2020_to_Present.csv"))

# Shohwing the results
sweet_report.show_notebook(w="100%", h="full")
source.0fe1ac3c:
from autoviz.AutoViz_Class import AutoViz_Class
AV = AutoViz_Class()
df_viz = AV.AutoViz('../input/los-angeles-crime-data-20102020/Crime_Data_from_2010_to_2019.csv')
source.0843bfe3:
# importing required packages
import pandas_profiling

#importing the data
df = pd.read_csv('../input/los-angeles-crime-data-20102020/Crime_Data_from_2020_to_Present.csv')

#descriptive statistics
pandas_profiling.ProfileReport(df)

source.a4536db0:
🔍 4 Libraries to Automate Exploratory Data Analysis : A Little Demo 📊

Sometimes we search for the right piece of dataset or (maybe hundreds of datasets!) and we just wanna look at some of the characteristics of the dataset. These four libraries can come really handy on this kind of occasions.
